meanings.definition: To heap or pile up excessively.
meanings.sent1: I overheap my toys in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overheap her plate with food at dinner.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to overheap its nuts in the treehouse.
meanings.sent4: The students overheap their backpacks with heavy textbooks.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would overheap the wheelbarrow with fallen leaves.

meanings.sent1: The overheap of clothes in the laundry room made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: The overheap of papers on his desk toppled over in a gust of wind.
meanings.sent3: The overheap of candy in the jar tempted the children.
meanings.sent4: The overheap of dishes in the sink signaled a busy day.
meanings.sent5: The overheap of presents under the tree delighted the family.
